description: {"blocks":[{"key":"cd0se","text":"This is the quick version of the Monarch® Plasmid DNA Miniprep Kit Protocol (NEB #T1010). For the full protocol, please click here.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":126,"length":4}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"0FF185D1BE0442ED85437E75A08F9158","url":"https://www.neb.com/protocols/2015/11/20/monarch-plasmid-dna-miniprep-kit-protocol-t1010"}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"c8m66","text":"For detailed protocol and more information, visit www.neb.com/T1010","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":50,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":50,"length":17}],"data":{}},{"key":"elscu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6lqpp","text":"The full protocol is available here.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":31,"length":4}],"data":{}},{"key":"euj2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ldn6","text":"The video protocol is available here.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":32,"length":4}],"data":{}},{"key":"dn54t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2a6gc","text":"General Guidelines:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fdnih","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5niv4","text":"Yield and quality of plasmid DNA is affected by plasmid copy number, plasmid size, insert toxicity, host strain, antibiotic selection, growth media and culture conditions. For standard cloning strains of E. coli, we recommend using a single colony from a freshly streaked selective plate to inoculate a standard growth media, such as LB (Luria-Bertaini) media. Cultures are typically grown at 37°C and 200–250 RPM in vessels that allow some aeration (Erlenmeyer flasks or culture tubes on a roller drum) and harvested after 12–16 hours as the culture transitions from logarithmic growth to stationary phase. This is the time at which the plasmid DNA content is highest. While cultures in LB often saturate with a final OD600between 3–6, growth to saturation often leads to cell lysis. As a result, plasmid yields and quality are reduced and the likelihood of co-purifying unwanted host chromosomal DNA increases. Use of rich media, such as 2X YT or TB, produces higher biomass in a shorter time period. If chosen for growth, adjustments to the culture times and amount of cells used in the prep should be made to correct for these differences, and to avoid overloading the matrix and reducing DNA yield and quality.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":204,"length":7},{"style":"sub","offset":721,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"adrcl","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"q1je","text":"        PLASMID  REPLICON  COPY  CLASSIFICATION        NUMBER      pUC and its derivatives  pMB1*  \u003e 75  High copy    pBR322 and its derivatives  pMB1  15–20  Low copy    pACYC and its derivatives  p15A  10–12  Low copy    pSC101  pSC101  ~5    ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":245}],"data":{}},{"key":"f9fru","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ob45","text":"Antibiotics for Plasmid Selection ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":33}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4bl57","text":"ANTIBIOTICCONCENTRATION OFSTOCK SOLUTIONSTORAGETEMP.WORKING CONCENTRATIONAmpicillin100 mg/ml (H2O) –20°C50–200 μg/mlCarbenicillin100 mg/ml (H2O)–20°C20–200 μg/mlChloramphenicol34 mg/ml (ethanol)–20°C25–170 μg/mlKanamycin10 mg/ml (H2O) –20°C10–50 μg/mlStreptomycin10 mg/ml (H2O)–20°C10–50 μg/mlTetracycline5 mg/ml (ethanol)–20°C10–50 μg/ml","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":338}],"data":{}},{"key":"75lo2","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c87t7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"EB48C48D85CF424BA0669E371161DED3","url":"https://www.neb.com/products/t1010-monarch-plasmid-miniprep-kit"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"0E012C3B0F59423493B6BD10061E0565","url":"https://www.neb.com/protocols/2015/11/20/monarch-plasmid-dna-miniprep-kit-protocol-t1010"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"2D304D0E49964CD7ADA3F6EF6F462006","url":"https://international.neb.com/tools-and-resources/video-library?device=modal\u0026amp;videoid=95f48dda-61cc-4b4a-a1cd-582234665960"}},"3":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","0_2":"","0_3":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","1_2":"","1_3":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","2_2":"","2_3":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","3_2":"","3_3":"","4_0":"","4_1":"","4_2":"","4_3":"","5_0":"","5_1":"","5_2":"","5_3":"","A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"C_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"D_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["","","",""],"colWidths":["201","101","101","194"],"data":[["PLASMID","REPLICON","COPY NUMBER","CLASSIFICATION"],["pUC and its derivatives","pMB1*","\u0026gt; 75","High copy"],["pBR322 and its derivatives","pMB1","15–20","Low copy"],["pACYC and its derivatives","p15A","10–12","Low copy"],["pSC101","pSC101","~5",""]],"guid":"0DEE7985965711ECB46F0A58A9FEAC02","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":3,"offset":33,"style":"italic"}],"key":"t9hr","text":"*pUC and its derivatives lack theRopgene and contain a point mutation in the RNAII transcript. These changes result in higher copy number during routine growth with many sources reporting levels as high as 500 copies per cell.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["PLASMID","REPLICON","COPY NUMBER","CLASSIFICATION"],["pUC and its derivatives","pMB1*","\u0026gt; 75","High copy"],["pBR322 and its derivatives","pMB1","15–20","Low copy"],["pACYC and its derivatives","p15A","10–12","Low copy"],["pSC101","pSC101","~5",""]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23]}},"4":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"1_0":"","1_1":"","1_2":"","1_3":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","2_2":"","2_3":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","3_2":"","3_3":"","4_0":"","4_1":"","4_2":"","4_3":"","5_0":"","5_1":"","5_2":"","5_3":"","6_0":"","6_1":"","6_2":"","6_3":""},"colTitles":["ANTIBIOTIC","CONCENTRATION OFSTOCK SOLUTION","STORAGETEMP.","WORKING CONCENTRATION"],"colWidths":["121","240",100,"213"],"data":[["","","",""],["Ampicillin","100 mg/ml (H2O)\u0026nbsp;","–20°C","50–200 μg/ml"],["Carbenicillin","100 mg/ml (H2O)","–20°C","20–200 μg/ml"],["Chloramphenicol","34 mg/ml (ethanol)","–20°C","25–170 μg/ml"],["Kanamycin","10 mg/ml (H2O)","\u0026nbsp;–20°C","10–50 μg/ml"],["Streptomycin","10 mg/ml (H2O)","–20°C","10–50 μg/ml"],["Tetracycline","5 mg/ml (ethanol)","–20°C","10–50 μg/ml"]],"guid":"486A4001965711ECB46F0A58A9FEAC02","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["","","",""],["Ampicillin","100 mg/ml (H2O)\u0026nbsp;","–20°C","50–200 μg/ml"],["Carbenicillin","100 mg/ml (H2O)","–20°C","20–200 μg/ml"],["Chloramphenicol","34 mg/ml (ethanol)","–20°C","25–170 μg/ml"],["Kanamycin","10 mg/ml (H2O)","\u0026nbsp;–20°C","10–50 μg/ml"],["Streptomycin","10 mg/ml (H2O)","–20°C","10–50 μg/ml"],["Tetracycline","5 mg/ml (ethanol)","–20°C","10–50 μg/ml"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

There should be no visible clumps.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"febcl","text":" ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"779hp","text":" ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"arhhr","text":"Add  , gently invert tube 5–6 times, and incubate at   for  . Do not vortex.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":62,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":53,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":59,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fv67l","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","guid":"76EB7DE0A8F511EAA3FD2BF4ACC32E18","id":0,"label":"Plasmid Lysis Buffer (B2) (green)","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"8C259AB0A8F511EAA3FD2BF4ACC32E18","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"4","unit":32}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"8FFD0880A8F511EAA3FD2BF4ACC32E18","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6nlet","text":"Care should be taken not to handle the sample roughly and risk shearing chromosomal DNA, which will co-purify as a contaminant. Avoid incubating longer than one minute to prevent irreversible plasmid denaturation.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"20d87","text":"Add  , gently invert tube until neutralized, and incubate at   for  . Do not vortex.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":70,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":61,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":67,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bqds2","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"400","guid":"B146EA10A8F511EAA3FD2BF4ACC32E18","id":0,"label":"Plasmid Neutralization Buffer (B3) (yellow)","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"B6A238C0A8F511EAA3FD2BF4ACC32E18","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"4","unit":32}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"BE254970A8F511EAA3FD2BF4ACC32E18","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2551b","text":"Be careful not to shear chromosomal DNA by vortexing or vigorous shaking. Firmly inverting the tube promotes good mixing, important for full neutralization.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9v6fv","text":"Centrifuge lysate at   for 2-5 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":21,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8itqt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"98vkh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"16000","duration":0,"guid":"F60AFAB0A8F511EAA3FD2BF4ACC32E18","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dfvns","text":"Spin time should not be less than 2 minutes. Careful handling of the tube will ensure no debris is transferred and the 2 minute recommended spin can be successfully employed to save valuable time. For culture volumes \u003e 1 ml, we recommend a 5 minute spin to ensure efficient RNA removal by RNase A. Also, longer spin times will result in a more compact pellet that lower the risk of clogging the column.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fl6ql","text":"Carefully transfer supernatant to the spin column and centrifuge for  . Discard flow-through.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":69,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"FE4D8AD0A8F511EAA3FD2BF4ACC32E18","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5n3gc","text":"Re-insert column in the collection tube and add  . Centrifuge for  . ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":48,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":66,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ahhi1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","guid":"183D4070A8F611EAA3FD2BF4ACC32E18","id":0,"label":"Plasmid Wash Buffer 1","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"1C8411E0A8F611EAA3FD2BF4ACC32E18","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3foe6","text":"Discarding the flow-through is optional. The collection tube is designed to hold 800 μl of flow-through fluid and still allow the tip of the column to be safely above the top of the liquid. Empty the tube whenever necessary to ensure the column tip and flow-through do not make contact.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b7j4d","text":"Transfer column to a clean 1.5 ml microfuge tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2r0ad","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":142}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"enifr","text":"Use care to ensure that the tip of the column does not come into contact with the flow-through. If there is any doubt, re-spin the column for  .","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"duration":60,"guid":"397F59D0A8F611EAA3FD2BF4ACC32E18","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"duration"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"19csj","text":"Add ≥   to the center of the matrix. Wait for  , then spin at   for   to elute DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":6,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":46,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":62,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":68,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9l7gc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"30","guid":"40CED760A8F611EAA3FD2BF4ACC32E18","id":0,"label":"DNA Elution Buffer","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"45565B50A8F611EAA3FD2BF4ACC32E18","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"16000","duration":0,"guid":"50B2AE90A8F611EAA3FD2BF4ACC32E18","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"498F4A10A8F611EAA3FD2BF4ACC32E18","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"4":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":21},{"key":1,"length":1,"offset":23},{"key":2,"length":1,"offset":454}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"djviq","text":"Nuclease-free water ( – ) can also be used to elute the DNA. Delivery of the Monarch DNA Elution Buffer should be made directly to the center of the column to ensure the matrix is completely covered for maximal efficiency of elution. Additionally, yield may slightly increase if a larger volume of DNA Elution Buffer is used, but the DNA will be less concentrated as a result of dilution. For larger plasmids (≥ 10 kb), heating the DNA Elution Buffer to   prior to eluting and extending the incubation time after buffer addition to 5 minutes can improve yield.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bpgap","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"74821A00965611EC9C0A8F7B1B0A5A04","id":0,"number":"7"},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"ph"},"1":{"data":{"guid":"782A6180965611EC9C0A8F7B1B0A5A04","id":0,"number":"8.5"},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"ph"},"2":{"data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"7E0BD020965611EC9C0A8F7B1B0A5A04","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"50","unit":10},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"temperature"}}}}}}
